title: Instead of replacing Zeke's with another item, why not just ADD an item?
body:
Why does Riot feel like we need to be capped at a specific number of items in the game?  Why can't we have both?

As it stands, Zeke's is the one aura item that actually helps AD casters, and acts as a nice analogue to what Abyssal does for AP champs (was closer when it was Stark's, but still).  Players just got done expressing how much they dislike losing magus to get runeglaive, and it's a sentiment that's been expressed in the past (probably will be again if you decide to push through the Abyssal replacement)... and now you want to push Zeke's out?  I understand it's not the most popular item, but it's actually GOOD.  If you want to look at helping items, how about starting with the items that actually suck (every other support item besides Locket/Zeke's/Crucible/maybe Censer).

Also, on a separate note, can we get MORE manaless items rather than fewer?  It opens up so many more build paths when I can choose to get my mana on one item and not have to double down on it.  Is Zekes' 250 mana going to be enough to sustain a build that needs mana?  No.  Are there other items that don't sustain a build by themselves, but count on picking up another 250 mana to help you do so?  No, it's a bit greedy for support to count on that.  Please let us keep old Zeke's if you feel the need to push this item into the game.

I actually like building the current Zeke's Herald...and if it goes, I'm going to be disappointed.

But knowing Riot, they'll just remove it like they did with Magus :(
Not like anybody actually like's Zeke's as it is now. No big loss.

I do.  Supports should.

In any case, if it's doing no harm, just leave it alone.

http://www.lolking.net/items/3050#statistics

> It is grossly underused

Agreed.

> and slot-inefficient

It's god tier with some comps, and trash tier with others. This makes it a niche item.
Contrary to popular belief, not every item has to be a Last Whisper.
Zeke's Herald is one of the most slot / gold efficient items in the entire game.
Every single non-tank support in the game would rather have this new Zeke's than the current one.
Agree to disagree, I guess.  One's a true aura, the other is just a buff for two people, one of whom is the support that won't use it well anyway.

Have you used it yet? I doubt you have. so please until its out. dont knock it. Personally, i love the new item. I play support....a lot even though I hate playing it and the only time i get zekes is on Taric (standard imo) and RARELY leona. So what does that say about the item?

You misunderstand my post.  I don't care that a new item is being created, nor do I really care how strong it is.

What I DO care about is Riot removing an item I HAVE played with and I like to build:  current Zeke's.  I don't see why everytime Riot gives us something, they have to take something else away.

But you should care about how strong it is. Supports are already slotcapped out the wazzoo, you already need/want  {{item:2049}} {{item:3117}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3041}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3050}}    more items than you have slots for and this new item is actually going to be so strong that if you don't rush it after sight stone you're going to lose mid game to the adc with 50% extra crit chance during every fight. I like the current Zeke's too when I'm ahead but if the new version is released and it isn't extremely awkward/hard to get the passive off, then it's going to be a must buy. So now a Taric build is {{item:2049}} {{item:3117}}  New Zeke's {{item:3110}}  {{item:3222}}  {{item:3401}}  with no room to build {{item:3800}}  much less {{item:3050}}

20% AP is nothing to snub, especially with many supports now grabbing at least a single AP item each game, often three depending on how well they go. 
The added crit chance of course is also a massive buff to utility as you can give your ADC near 100% crit chance mid and late game for some massive dueling power.  Or if you've a fed mage or assassin you can stick with them and give them 4/7th of a rabbadon passive. 

The problem with the current {{item:3050}} is that the bulk of supports have no use for AD or lifesteal and it really doesn't grant enough combat stats to justify the purchase.

Here's the deal with that. It isn't "no harm." Especially for new players, it's important to keep the item numbers down; that's why Riot is doing it. A game with 500 items would be unmanageable for everyone and impossible to balance. Riot is working hard to make sure the items in the game have significant impact.

While I appreciate your opinion that the current Zeke's is fine, I'm sure they have data that shows you in the minority. Most people don't build the item, and if you want to know why, you can read the red post. It did a great job of outlining that issue. The fact is that aura items are just balls of stats, and while some players find that incredibly useful, few find it fun. It's better to introduce some new mechanics into the game to spice things up.

The same can be said for Runeglaive; Riot is taking away the ball of stats magus and adding an item that's a little more interactive. I can understand why people are frustrated with this approach, but in most of these cases, people don't complain as much once they play with the new item and see how it works... 

Yes, people will still complain about Fidd in the jungle without magus. Yes, people will still complain about Zeke's being gone. But Riot have the data, and if it shows more people building new Zeke's than old, they're going to feel like they've done their job, regardless of what the boards posts say.

>Players just got done expressing how much they dislike losing magus to get runeglaive, and it's a sentiment that's been expressed in the past (probably will be again if you decide to push through the Abyssal replacement).

Actually, I like the idea of the abyssal rework.  While it won't be much of a mage/assassin item anymore, it will be a pretty huge buff to tank champs, especially when you combo with Sunfire/Cinderhulk.

I like it, too. It's in a similar category to Black Cleaver, where it helps bruisers soften up targets for its respective damage type, but it's not something that can be built by assassins using that damage type to stack penetration and become unstoppable on their own. The current Abyssal Scepter's instant gratification aura means you're as likely to see it on LeBlanc as Diana. I feel it's an improvement. The only issue is that they said they have something else in store to address mages' need for MR, and we haven't seen what that is yet.

The trick will be what to give it in return.  Sure you've got {{item:3174}} which gives you a little of most of the stats a mage and some assassins will want, though it's a little underpowered at the moment, but something that will be a bit more along the stat lines of {{item:3157}}  (And I say along the lines, not exactly), in order to make it a good item for itemization.  Do you just do flat AP and MR or do you want to come up with a unique means of giving those stats or some passives that will work for mages and/or assassins?

Well, what I was trying to say is that players will be disappointed if current Abyssal gets removed, even if a new item takes its place (which, as you said, new Abyssal actually won't do very well - it'll be geared towards tanks rather than mage/assassins).

The current Abyssal favors AP bruisers, the rework idea will still be viable on AP bruisers, but will be less useful on AP Assassins (I'm looking at you {{champion:55}} ).  The difference is that while it will still be useful on AP bruisers, it will also give a strong power spike to tanks.

I main GP support.

I found it really fun to analyse the game state to decide whether or not to pick Zeke's up.  It even affected my mastery choices pre game if I thought the team was one that could do well with Zeke's.  Meaningful mastery and build path choice are pretty rare for supports, and part of the reason why I grew to prefer GP to the other options.

I understand the "hidden power" argument against bonus stat auras, but I disagree with the analysis of it's impact.  When I pick up Zeke's and our team is behind and then suddenly demolishes in a team fight, I more often than not get a comment from my team going "uhhh what just happened?!".  Conversation about Zeke's ensues, and sometimes rallies a demoralized team - not only is this particularly satisfying for a support player, but even better for sup GP main, to get some kudos instead of the MUCH more common raging and presumed uselessness.

I will miss this item.  I will miss current GP when he is gone. I am nervous about the place a player like myself will have in this game afterwards.

I feel exactly the same way. Zeke's live incarnation was my ace in the hole as Braum, not always effective in every situation but a truly awesome rallying boost to my team when it was. It was a cheap way to get decent CDR, tank, and sustain, and show my own team a way out from being behind when we were. It may have been little more than a green circle on the ground, but when the enemy teams start melting people took notice, and stuck close to their support for a change. If I could get that built on a team with even two decent damage dealers that were willing to AA, I could help just about anyone get better fed vs. just about anything, and as a Support Braum main that was all I could ever ask or hope for.

And now they're taking that away, because "it doesn't have a very visible impact"?? Sorry, but I'm calling bullshit on that one.

Yeah, i like the current Zeke's and don't really see a need for a rework. 

That said if there were both items why would you chose one over the other. When two items are close enough to each other stat wise one will fall by the wayside because its just the worse choice a majority of the time.

I actually don't think they're that close, or at least no closer than either is to Censer.  

Current Zeke's is a true aura.  It hits everyone with no conditions other than the aura's radius.  New Zeke's is closer to an active buff, which only targets yourself and your ally, and has a time limit and stacking mechanic on it.  Honestly, the more I go into it, the more it seems Censer is the closer comparison to new Zeke's rather than old Zeke's, both for the conditionals and stat type it brings.  

I'm one of those (apparently) rare players who liked Zeke's, and I liked it for the lifesteal aura that can help you keep your ADC alive midgame when they have good damage from IE+PD, but no lifesteal yet.  Lifesteal also scales well into lategame, providing your ADC some strong sustain at that point in the game.  I guess I don't really understand what other items supports were building.  I never bought into stacking AP on traditional supports - most of their ratios (and ALL of their utility ratios) are weak.  Likewise, on tank support I prefer building stats for my team rather than for myself.  I see tank supports buy sunfires, and I wonder what they think that item's passive actually adds at the point in the game when they finish it.  I'll grant that mage support really has no business building Zeke's, but is that really such a bad thing?  Do we need to help mage supports see more play?
Giving free crit to the ADC, so fun, this game progresses in a good way...

First team to have IE finished on their ADC and Zeke's on their support (or anyone) just rushes anywhere for a teamfight and the ADC gets 70% crit chance for x2.5 AD crits.  Snowballing!  Healthy powercurves!  IE is even more firmly rooted in ADC builds!

I agree. Zeke's may be underused, but I like it. Make a new item, don't trash an old one.

Same with Abyssal Scepter.
I agree have a +1

Here is a response about live Zeke's on the PBE boards.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Axes,realm=PBE,application-id=2EAF660193FA3B668D7234B3AEBB530C5AB7F651,discussion-id=lEXEsgWL,comment-id=00090002,timestamp=2015-06-30T05:11:31.489+0000)
>
> Just wanted to chip in some context on why Zeke's needed this style of update.
> 
> Basically, live Zeke's requires **all** of the following to be true in a given game in order to be an efficient item:
> 
> * Your team must have multiple high-scaling AD auto attackers
> * You must be a peel support located near them and able to sacrifice an item slot to help them
> * Your opponents must be doing something (typically multiple Thornmails and minimal/no wombo combo) to increase the value of lifesteal
> 
> Add this to a bunch of clarity and satisfaction issues (invisible auras are always undervalued relative to their power level), plus an "ADC slave" element where you don't get to feel good about your own item purchase (unless you're support Gangplank), and you have an item which, even if balanced to actually be strong, very few players will ever buy or appreciate. The only way to get players to value it would be to make it egregiously overpowered.
> 
> One thing I want to call out, by the way:
> 
> You're getting at a really important concept - that the ability to understand itemization at a level where you can adapt within a game is a valued skill. That's a skill I'd really like to see more of - but with fully supported, valuable items that do broadly different things, rather than extremely niche items. In this case, it's very unlikely that you'll be able to fit both new Zeke's and Mikael's in a single build (not impossible, but you'll be sacrificing other stuff) - understanding when one or the other is more likely to help win the game is both an important decision and a nuanced decision, assuming we hit a good state balance-wise.
> 
> tl;dr: Old Zeke's was too specific to realistically be able to support and barely purchased; new Zeke's is a very different item but also an item that can be supported more broadly; we believe new Zeke's does offer interesting and nuanced decision-making in the support itemization space.

Yea, I've read it.  I don't buy into it.  How is new Zeke's any less an "ADC slave" item if I'm not building AP?  In fact, given that the item literally binds me to one person to give them a stat boost, I'd say it's even more a slave item.  

No doubt new Zeke's will be more flexible, but I'm not convinced we need to remove every niche item in the name of flexibility.  In fact, we could actually _support_ a game of niche items if Riot didn't feel the need to always take one item out when they bring one in.  

I also find it funny how they raise the concern of a support counting on getting multiple items in their build (Zeke's and Mikael's in the example), yet I'm supposed to care that new Zeke's has 250 mana?  Which support looks at that and says "ah, yes, now my build's mana issues are solved"?  No one.  You likely either didn't need that mana or you still need mana afterward.  Mind you, this is before I even get into all the problems that new Zeke's will introduce to the game - I'm just trying to show how it still has most of the problems current Zeke's does.

Think of your last 500 matches. o you remember anyone buying that item? I believe the item being reworked is a good thing, personally I have only bought him once on Olaf during the Snowdown Showdown event last year. The item was just not giving enough to be bought over other better items. 

Also, what support items do you think are bad?

Easy, _I_ bought the item.  Why do you think I care so much, lol?

Let me be clear here, when I talk about "support" items, I don't mean items supports _can_ buy, I mean items designed for supports, items that do support things (auras, buffs, actives, etc).  Among those items, I think Locket's great, Banner is almost always inferior to Locket, Zeke's was good, Crucible is OK, and Censer might be OK (the gp10 actives are fine too).  I think Ohmwrecker/Twin Shadows/ZZrot Portal all suck.  I don't really consider Righteous Glory or Frozen Heart to be support items (if you balk at my exclusion of the latter, I don't consider Abyssal Scepter any less of a support item than Frozen Heart, and I certainly wouldn't call Abyssal a support item even though it too has an aura).

> I think Ohmwrecker/Twin Shadows/ZZrot Portal all suck.

Going to have to disagree on this one.
Ohmwrecker is actually a very strong item. The problem is that it's set up to be a late-game buy. Guess when you need it's active least? If they were to rework it to be a viable rush item, I could see it being a staple in rush comps.
Twin shadows also has a really strong passive to accompany it's average stats.
Zz'Rot is just crazy strong; I build it on my solo laners! In addition to providing a good chunk of AR and MR, it also lets you set up monster waves on demand or push lanes from across the map.

That said though, none of them are going to be picked all the time. They each have their niche (Like Zeke's!), and do really well with that niche. Though they're a bit harder to use effectively.

Zzrot is a win-more item.  It helps when you're in position to protect the portal, still does little if you don't have the siege to back it up, and does nothing to save your towers from getting sieged themselves.  The build path bites and it suffers the exact same problem you listed for Ohmwrecker, imo.  Speaking of, saying Ohmwrecker is good if it were available early is a bit like saying grass would be red if it wasn't green.  

It really just sounds like you've defended 3 items no one buys by saying they'd be good if they weren't the items they currently are...which isn't actually saying they're good at all!

I regularly get shadows on my AP supports if I can afford it. The item isn't weak and the active is useful all game.
Zz'Rot is a staple buy on my tanks and some bruisers (even in solo lanes!). It's ability to manipulate lanes is grossly underestimated and makes it useful all game. Similar to how people grossly under-value Banner's ability to make a minion immune to magic damage.

Ohmwrecker is the only one I didn't defend in it's *current* state. It's not useful all game; and by the time you can reasonably get it, your tank can do it's job just as well. And in fact, thanks to tower agro getting reset by Ohmwrecker, it can actually mess up a dive by having it re-target a carry by mistake.
Ohmwrecker's active is strongest early game when your not going to get it; and weakest late game when it becomes an option. If it were reworked to be something more palatable early game (A split off chalice maybe?), it would become a strong niche item.

***EDIT:*** Just dawned on me. You arguing the reverse for these items that your are for Zeke's! Not really relevant to the topic at hand. Just kinda funny.

Well, I don't want to see ANY of the items removed.  I might not care for ZZrot/Twin Shadows/Ohmwrecker, but I also have no problem leaving them in the game either.  I'm only speaking to which support items I favor because I was asked directly about it (also because I'd like to see MORE items for support rather than DIFFERENT).

Lol. I can remember building it two days ago.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1870133181/34454005?tab=overview

I was really upset when I saw the Zeke's changes.  It's such an unique item!  If they feel like they HAVE to rework it, I wish they'd do something else than just turning it into another AP support item...  Zeke's identity is that it gives lifesteal and AD to allies, and it's a rarely chosen item but I can remember all the times I've built it.  And it was great when I actually had need for it.  I want them to add this "rework" as a new item and to do something else with Zeke's but to do something with it that doesn't change it into something unrecognizable.  Keep it AD/lifesteal related.  Let it have it's little niche identity.  It doesn't have to be a must-buy item to be a good item.  And if they insist on changing EVERYTHING about the item so that it shares no similarities with its current state whatsoever (which I think this change does), just retire Zeke's and add the item under a new name...because this thing, whatever it is, is definitely not a Zeke's Herald.
I bought old Zeke's on Nami when we had 3 AD characters. You really didn't need an all ad team. Even tanks have to auto attack so the aura is only wasted on mages and supports.

They are removing old Zeke's because they want diversity, just like when they removed Magus and the summoner spell Revive...
...
...
lol

It used to be burden of knowledge to learn the game.

However, they don't seem too concerned with that on champion designs anymore as every new champion has at least one ability that's description is a paragraph and a headache to understand without seeing it in game.

As a general suggestion for everything Riot's been doing right now:

Why not keep both? -> Stacking might make it OP -> Make them share same unique passive names? -> Problem solved.

Why keep a bad item and add a good item when you can change a bad item to make it good?

Live Zeke's Herald isn't a good item. It's certainly cost efficient, but the number of champions that can use it's effect needs to be really high in order to make it good. For it to be good, you need a heavy AD comp to make it work, as 20 AD and 10% life steal isn't good on the tank or AP carries, and it certainly isn't good on the support that is using it. 

Then you do build a heavy AD comp to use it, but the problem with that is that the enemy team is just going to stack armor. At that point, your 10% life steal and 20 AD on every AD champ you have isn't going to be useful either, even with your team's armor penetration.

This also doesn't include the fact that the stats are TERRIBLE. 20% CDR is nice, but it limits your build options due to the CDR cap. You get 20% from this and 10% from your support item, leaving you with 10% CDR to fill your build with, and that is assuming you aren't running any CDR from masteries. This doesn't include the fact that most support items already have CDR on them, with the exception of Sightstone. 250 health also doesn't do much either.

Then look at PBE Zeke's Herald. Decent stats and an amazing active with a lot of utility on it that can even be useful on AP champs. It's still the support item oriented towards AD champions, it's just focused on making one champ insane and less on making the whole team a tiny bit better.

Because it's changing it into something it wasn't meant to be for champs it wasn't intended for at the expense of champs it was intended for! Imagine if Bloodthirster suddenly became an AP item, with nothing remotely equivalent to replace it. Or imagine a pair of boots suddenly became a gold item with nothing to do with movement speed. That's what we're dealing with here. 

And Zeke's is fine as is. No, it's not the most popular item on AP Supports because it wasn't meant for them in the first place! It's meant for tank supports and should be kept for them, not changed into yet another AP active item.

The difference between Zeke's and something like BT or boots getting changes is that BT and boots are core items that people actually build.

No one builds Zeke's Herald, and for good reason.

It's stats are bad (you can get better stats for 600 less gold with double Kindlegem) and its effect is either bad due to a lack of targets or is good because you built a bad team comp. It's a lose-lose situation.

The new Zeke's has an active that is strictly better for any target you would use current Zeke's on, and has decent stats to boot, even for tanky supports.

There's no reason to cry over losing Zeke's. It's a bad item, and nothing is being lost.

if anything, the new version seems superfluous when the old version filled a core niche that no other item even attempts to replicate.  would seem obvious to me, but how do you reason with people that honestly can't tell whether a change is going to hurt or help a character?

Of the 750+ games I've played, I have only ever seen Zeke's built maybe 4 times, and all of those times **I** was the one who built it. 

Does this mean they should remove it? No. Does this mean this new Zeke's sounds like a bad idea? No. Should they keep the current Zeke's and then introduce a new item? Not really.  

There's no right or wrong way to go about this situation. I personally think the current Zeke's is fine and shouldn't be tinkered with at all, but is that what Riot thinks? Well, considering the dilemma at hand, no. Does that mean we as a community should complain? No.
Riot seems to buy into the idea that if an item isn't bought 100% of the time on certain champs/archetypes it's useless and needs to be removed or reworked

That would explain why we only ever have 3 items getting built on any given class, and why Riot feels the need to keep the item pool so small.

It really annoys me to hear them preach about diversity and niches, then decide to eliminate any support for such things.  New Zeke's won't be niche, it'll be must-buy or trash.  There's nothing about it that makes it better one game than the next.

I LOVE, I mean L O V E Zeke's Herald when I play my aura supports. Basically what I'm saying is, when I play Soraka and my duo buddy is playing Vayne, having some extra AD and Lifesteal is always perfect and great since I don't need to live I need to let my carries live to dominate.

I am sick of aura AP and MR items.

Seriously, where's the aura AD items?
I agree so much with this. I'm tired of riot removing items and giving us a shitty replacement.  (I HATE LUDENS ECHO WITH A PASSION. RIP DFG).they really need to stop removing items.
